messages.content: Jacob puts all of his pennies and nickels in his piggy bank. He has saved up a total of 476 coins. Altogether, there is a total of $11.33 in his bank. How many pennies and how many nickels does he have in his piggy bank?

Emily went to the movie theater for her birthday. A mix of adults and children attended, making a total of 22 people. Each adult ticket was $9 and each child’s ticket was $5.50. If the total cost for the party was $125.50, then how many adults and how many children attended?
The sum of the ages of Nicole and Kristin is 31. In four years, Nicole will be five times as old as Kristin. How old are they now?
Helena had 21% more savings than Jane. They have saved 1803 CZK. How much have Helena and Jane held?
A plane took 4 hours to fly 2400 km with a tailwind. On the trip back flying into the same headwind the trip took 6 hours. Find the speed of the wind.
A rectangle has a perimeter of 41 cm. If the length is 3 cm longer than twice the width, find the length and width.

In a candy shop, chocolate which sells for $7 a pound is mixed with nuts which are sold for $2.42 a pound are mixed to form a chocolate-nut candy which sells for $3.6 a pound. How much of each are used to make 29 pounds of the mixture?
If twice the age of son is added to age of father, the sum is 55. But if twice the age of the father is added to the age of son, the sum is 84. Find the ages of father and son.
A farmer has some cream which is 20% butterfat and some which is 14% butter fat. How many gallons of each must be mixed to produce 63 gallons of cream which is 22% butterfat?

You and a friend go to Tacos Galore for lunch. You order five soft tacos and three burritos and your total bill is $11.37. Your friend's bill is $10.24 for three soft tacos and two burritos. How much do soft tacos cost? How much do burritos cost?

A student lives 13 km from school. On her morning commute, she walks to a bus stop at an average speed of 8 km/h. She then rides the bus for the remainder of the distance, at an average speed of 44 km/h. If the entire trip takes 30 minutes, what are the times spent walking and riding the bus?
The sum of the digits in a two-digit number is 12. Furthermore, the number itself is 4 greater than 10 times the tens digits. Find the number.
The sum of half of a number, x, and another number, y, is -31. The difference of x and y is 5. Find x and y.
The length of a rectangle is 7 units more than the width, and the perimeter is 36 units more than the length. What are the rectangle's dimensions?

The perimeter of a rectangle is 84 units. If the height was increased by 2 units and the width was cut in half, the new perimeter would be 94 units. What were the original dimensions of the rectangle?

Olivia’s family drove to Disney Land for spring break. Her mom and dad shared the driving duties for a total of 14 hours. Her mom drove 65 miles per hour, and her dad drove 60 miles per hour. If they drove a total of 895 miles, how many hours did each person drive for?

Rodney’s Kitchen Supplies makes and sells spoons and forks. It costs the store $5 to buy the supplies needed to make a fork, and $1 for the supplies needed to make a spoon. The store sells the forks for $4 and the spoons for $6. Last month Rodney’s Kitchen Supplies spent $37 on supplies and sold the all of the forks and spoons that were made last month using those supplies for $93. How many forks and spoons did they make?
The perimeter of a rectangle is 27 inches. The length is 6 less than 1 times the width. What is the length of the rectangle?
The length of a rectangle is 6 cm more than double its width, and the perimeter is 35 cm. Determine its length and width.

Michael breeds chickens and ducks. Last month, he sold 48 chickens and 31 ducks for $553. This month, he sold 47 chickens and 35 ducks for $534. How much does a chicken cost, and how much does a duck cost?
The width of a rectangle is 5 cm less than the length. If the perimeter is 55 cm, what is the width?
A carpet manufacturer blends two fibers, one 23% wool and the second 51% wool. How many pounds of each fiber should be woven together to produce 602 lb of a fabric that is 31% wool?
A rectangle has perimeter 19. If each side of the rectangle is doubled, the perimeter of the new rectangle is 39. What were the dimensions of the original rectangle?
A candy mix sells for $2.20 per kilogram. It contains chocolates worth $1.80 per kilogram and other candy worth $3.00 per kilogram. How much of each are in 15 kilograms of the mixture?
Twice the width of a rectangle is one inches more than the length. The perimeter is nineteen inches. Find the dimensions of the rectangle.
A grocer wishes to mix sugar at 9 cents per pound with sugar at 6 cents per pound to make 60 pounds at 7 cents per pound. What quantity of each must he take?
A rectangle has a width 2.1 cm shorter than its length. The perimeter of this rectangle is 10.6 cm. Find the dimensions of rectangle.
A plane can fly 3752 km in 3 hours with the wind. The plane takes 4 hours to travel the same distance against the same wind speed. Find the rate of the plane in still air. Find the speed of the wind.
Two angles are supplementary. The larger angle is 51 degrees more than 10 times the smaller angle. Find the measure of each angle.

A passenger and a freight train start toward each other at the same time from two points 301 miles apart. If the rate of the passenger train exceeds the rate of the freight train by 16 miles per hour, and they meet after 6 hours, what must the rate of each be?
Renee left the restaurant traveling 20 mph. Then, 5 hours later, Karen left traveling the same direction at 26 mph. How long until Karen catches up with Renee?

Ava’s family drove to Disney Land for spring break. Her mom and dad shared the driving duties for a total of 27 hours. Her mom drove 77 miles per hour, and her dad drove 62 miles per hour. If they drove a total of 1709 miles, how many hours did each person drive for?
If twice the age of son is added to age of father, the sum is 59. But if twice the age of the father is added to the age of son, the sum is 81. Find the ages of father and son.
A 9001-seat amphitheater has tickets for sale at $33 and $61. How many tickets should be sold at each price for a sellout performance to generate a total revenue of $382500?
The perimeter of a rectangular swimming pool is 153 feet. The length is 15 feet more than the width. Find the length and width.

On total $14998 are deposited into simple interest accounts. The annual simple interest rate on one account is at 7%, the annual simple interest rate on the second account is at 6%. How much should be invested in each account so that the total interest earned is $971?
The length of a rectangle is 2 cm more than double its width, and the perimeter is 33 cm. Determine its length and width.

Jacob puts all of his pennies and nickels in his piggy bank. He has saved up a total of 473 coins. Altogether, there is a total of $10.95 in his bank. How many pennies and how many nickels does he have in his piggy bank?
The sum of half a number, x, and another number, y, is 54. The difference of x and y is 20. Find x and y.

Eudora ran from her home to her secret laboratory at an average speed of 10 km/h. She then took one of her jetpacks and flew to her school at an average speed of 74 km/h. Eudora traveled a total distance of 119 kilometers, and the entire trip took 2 hours. How long did Eudora run and how long did she fly?
A rectangle has a perimeter of 38 cm. If the length is 0 cm longer than twice the width, find the length and width.
If the perimeter of a rectangular garden is 60 m and the length is 8 m more than the width, what are the dimensions of the garden?
Girls are 13 more than boys, and boys represent 32% of all students. Find how many girls are in the class.

To make a weed and feed mixture, the Green Thumb Garden Shop mixes fertilizer worth $4.00/lb. with a weed killer worth $8.00/lb. The mixture will cost $6.00/lb. How much of each should be used to prepare 500 lb. of the mixture?

You are running a concession stand at a football game. You are selling hamburgers and sodas. Each hamburger costs $2.50 and each soda costs $0.50. At the end of the night you made a total of $105. You sold a total of 80 hamburgers and sodas combined. You must report the number of hamburgers sold and the number of sodas sold. How many hamburgers were sold and how many sodas were sold?
The difference of twice a smaller integer and 5 times a larger is 5. When 5 times the larger integer is subtracted from 3 times the smaller, the result is −4. Find the integers.
Harry’s $2,200 savings is in two accounts. One account earns 2% annual interest and the other earns 4%. His total interest for the year is $69. How much does he have in each account?

When Famke charges her phone, it gains 1 percentage points each minute. When Famke uses her phone, it loses 4 percentage points each minute. Once, Famke used her phone for some time, and then charged it for twice the amount of time she used it. In the end, her phone lost 8 percentage points. How long did Famke use her phone and how long did she charge it?
The perimeter of a rectangle is 27 inches. The length is 7 less than 1 times the width. What is the length of the rectangle?

Yochanan walked from home to the bus stop at an average speed of 8 km/h. He immediately got on his school bus and traveled at an average speed of 63km/h until he got to school. The total distance is 35 kilometers, and the entire trip took 1.2 hours. How many kilometers did Yochanan cover by walking, and how many kilometers did he cover by traveling on the bus.

A class of 35 consists of students who either have red or yellow shirts. If there are 15 more people with red shirts than there are people with yellow shirts, how many of the students have red shirts?
The difference of two numbers is 14. The greater number is 5 less than 3 times the smaller number. Find the two numbers.
Sandy was able to purchase a pencil for $0.99 with quarters and dimes. If she uses 7 coins to buy the pencil, then how many of each did she have?

Margaret has her total savings of $24201 in two different CD accounts. One CD earns 4.3% interest and another earns 3.4% interest. If her total interest for the year is $1007.48, then how much does she have in each CD account?
Two angles of a triangle are the same size. The third angle is 13° smaller than the first angle. Find the measure of the angles.

Nick and Chloe left their campsite by canoe and paddled downstream at an average speed of 12 km/h. They turned around and paddled back upstream at an average rate of 4 km/h. The total trip took 1 hour. After how much time did the campers turn around downstream?

A coffee merchant wants to make 8 lb of a blend of coffee costing $8 per pound. The blend is made using a $9-per-pound grade and a $6-per-pound grade of coffee. How many pound of each of these grades should be used?
The perimeter of a rectangle is 37 centimeter. The length is zero more than twice the width. Find the length and the width of the rectangle.

On a 223 mi trip, a car traveled at an average speed of 50 mph and then reduced its average speed to 38 mph for the remainder of the trip. The trip took a total of 7 h. How long did the car travel at each speed?
The length of a rectangle is 1 m more than twice its width. If the perimeter is 113 m, find the dimensions.
The sum of the ages of Nicole and Kristin is 31. In five years, Nicole will be three times as old as Kristin. How old are they now?

Two small planes start from the same point and fly in opposite directions. The first plane is flying 28 km/h slower than the second plane. In five hours, the planes are 429 kilometres apart. Find the rate of each plane.
A 99-foot cable is cut into two pieces. The first piece is 20 feet longer than the second.  How long is each piece of cable?

A ground meat mixture is formed by combining meat that costs $2.66 per pound with meat that costs $3.57 per pound. How many pounds of each were used to make a 51 lb mixture that costs $2.85 per pound?
One number is 9 less than another number. The sum of the numbers is 63. Find the numbers.
The sum of two numbers is 24. One is 8 less than twice the other. Find the two numbers.
Pure sugar is to be mixed with a fruit salad containing 11% sugar to produce 63 ounces of a salad containing 18% sugar. How much pure sugar is required?
The length of a rectangle is 2 cm more than double its width, and the perimeter is 34 cm. Determine its length and width.
A rectangle has a perimeter of 40 cm. If the length is 2 cm longer than twice the width, find the length and width.

An executive traveled a total of 4 hours and 873 miles by car and by plane. Driving to the airport by car, she averaged 52 miles per hour. In the air, the plane averaged 322 miles per hour. How long did it take her to drive to the airport?

Joe spends 3 hour each morning exercising by jogging and then cycling for a total of 16 miles. He is able to average 5 miles per hour jogging and 16 miles per hour cycling. How long does he spend jogging each morning?

You and a friend go to Tacos Galore for lunch. You order one soft tacos and five burritos and your total bill is $11.35. Your friend's bill is $9.44 for six soft tacos and three burritos. How much do soft tacos cost? How much do burritos cost?
The perimeter of a rectangle is 51 inches. The length of the rectangle is 7 inches more than the width. Determine the dimensions of the rectangle.
The perimeter of a rectangle is 35 centimeter. The length is four more than twice the width. Find the length and the width of the rectangle.

Michael breeds chickens and ducks. Last month, he sold 50 chickens and 31 ducks for $552. This month, he sold 43 chickens and 39 ducks for $535. How much does a chicken cost, and how much does a duck cost?

A crew team rowed 19 miles in 3 hours, going with the current. Traveling against the current, it rowed 10 miles in the same amount of time. Find the rate of the crew in still water and the rate of the current.

The manager of a specialty food store combined almonds that cost $4.50 per pound with walnuts that cost $2.50 per pound. How many pounds of each were used to make a 100 lb mixture that cost $3.24 per pound?
The width of a rectangle is 14 cm less than the length. The perimeter is 155 cm. Find the width and length.
The width of a rectangle is 6 cm less than the length. If the perimeter is 52 cm, what is the width?
The length of a rectangle is 4 units more than the width, and the perimeter is 34 units more than the length. What are the rectangle's dimensions?
Two apples and seven bananas cost $4.21. Six apples and eight bananas cost $9.17. Find the cost of an apple.

A passenger and a freight train start toward each other at the same time from two points 298 miles apart. If the rate of the passenger train exceeds the rate of the freight train by 15 miles per hour, and they meet after 6 hours, what must the rate of each be?
One number exceeds another number by seventeen. The sum of twice the greater and three times the smaller is eighty-five. Find the numbers.
A farmhouse shelters 12 animals, some are pigs, and some are ducks. Altogether there are 37 legs. How many pigs are there?
The perimeter of a rectangle is 43 inches. The length is 5 inches longer than the width. Find the length and width of the rectangle.
The sum of six times a number, x, and another number, y, is 0. The difference of x and y is 70. Find x and y.

A geometry teacher has a set of 60 plastic pentagons and octagons. She happened to notice that all the figures together have a total of 353 sides (she had lots of spare time to count).  How many of each shape are there?

When Famke charges her phone, it gains 5 percentage points each minute. When Famke uses her phone, it loses 7 percentage points each minute. Once, Famke used her phone for some time, and then charged it for twice the amount of time she used it. In the end, her phone lost 12 percentage points. How long did Famke use her phone and how long did she charge it?
A boat traveled 337 miles downstream and back. The trip downstream took 15 hours. The trip back took 16 hours. What is the speed of the boat in still water? What is the speed of the current?
A hair dye is made by blending 7% hydrogen peroxide solution and a 4% hydrogen peroxide solution. How many mililiters of each are used to make a 300 ml solution that is 5% hydrogen peroxide?
A boat traveled 337 miles downstream and back. The trip downstream took 15 hours. The trip back took 13 hours. What is the speed of the boat in still water? What is the speed of the current?
It takes a boat 5 hours to travel 27 miles downstream and 3 hours to travel 19 miles upstream. What is the speed of the boat in still water and of the current of the river?

Randi and her daughter, Sierra, are white water rafting in Colorado. At the start of the day they are 162 miles apart. They begin traveling toward each other at the same time. Sierra's raft is traveling 9 mph faster than Randi's. If they meet in 8 hours, how fast was Randi's raft traveling?

The length of the Odra in Moravia is 45% of its length in Poland. The total length of the flow from the source to the sea is 1163 km. What is the distance in Moravia, and what is the distance in km on the Polish side?
Fran invested $700 in two funds that pay 5% and 5.15% annual interest. Fran’s combined annual interest is $40.92. How much of the $700 was invested in each fund?
How much of a 6% acid solution should be mixed with how much of a 16% acid solution so that you obtain 21 gallons of a 14% acid solution?
Three times the larger of two numbers is equal to seven times the smaller. The sum of the numbers is 19. Find the numbers.
A tea that is 20% jasmine is blended with a tea that is 15% jasmine. How many pounds of each tea are used to make 5 lb of tea that is 18% jasmine?
Two angles are supplementary. The larger angle is 50 degrees more than 10 times the smaller angle. Find the measure of each angle.
The larger of two numbers is 7 more than twice the smaller. If the smaller is subtracted from the larger, the result is 14. Find the numbers.
A jar consisting of only nickels and dimes contains 58 coins. If the total value is $4.20, how many of each coin is in the jar?
If the perimeter of a rectangle is 280 m and the width is 26 m less than the length, find its length and width.
Swimming with the current Jack can swim 2.0 miles in 0.4 hour. Swimming back, against the same current, he can only swim 3 miles in the same amount of time. How fast is the current?
Jim was able to purchase a pizza for $12.35 with quarters and dimes. If he uses 71 coins to buy the pizza, then how many of each did he have?
The larger of two numbers is 5 more than twice the smaller. If the smaller is subtracted from the larger, the result is 10. Find the numbers.

An airplane flying into a headwind travels the 1801-mile flying distance between two cities in 6 hours and 37 minutes. On the return flight, the same distance is traveled in 1 hours. Find the ground speed of the plane and the speed of the wind, assuming that both remain constant.
The sum of a number, x, and another number, y, is 112. The difference of x and y is 14. Find x and y.
The sum of half a number, x, and another number, y, is 56. The difference of x and y is 18. Find x and y.

Liam’s football team scored a total of 45 separate times this season, with a mix of touchdowns and field goals. Each touchdown is worth 5 points, and each field goal is worth 5 points. If the team scored a total of 299 points this season, how many touchdowns and field goals did they score?

In Lewis Carroll’s Through the Looking Glass, Tweedledum says, “The sum of your weight and twice mine is 361 pounds.” Then Tweedledee says, “The sum of your weight and twice mine is 364 pounds.” Find the weights of Tweedledum and Tweedledee.
The length of a rectangle is 9 cm less than double its width, and the perimeter is 67 cm. How long is its length?
A jar consisting of only nickels and dimes contains 60 coins. If the total value is $3.74, how many of each coin is in the jar?

William bought some tickets to see his favorite singer. He bought some adult tickets and some children’s tickets, for a total of 15 tickets. The adult tickets cost $29 per ticket, and the children’s tickets cost $23 per ticket. If he spent a total of $271, then how many adult and children’s tickets did he buy?
Fran invested $700 in two funds that pay 6% and 5.5% annual interest. Fran’s combined annual interest is $40.50. How much of the $700 was invested in each fund?

Tom and Jerry drove 273 total miles in 6 hours. Tom always drives 38 mph and Jerry always drives 58 mph. It's a wonder they can manage to remain friends. How many hours did Tom drive and how many hours did Jerry drive?

Two trains start at the same time from the same place and travel in opposite directions. If the rate of one is 8 km/h more than the rate of the other and they are 169 kilometres apart at the end of 4 hours, what is the rate of each?

The price, x, of an entertainment system at Extreme Electronics is $220 less than twice the price, y, of the same system at Ultra Electronics. The difference in price between the system at Extreme Electronics and Ultra Electronics is $173. Which system of linear equations can be used to determine the price of the system at each store?

At a college bookstore, Carla purchased a math textbook and a novel that cost a total of $54, not including tax. If the price of the math textbook, x, is $8 more than 3 times the price of the novel, y, which system of linear equations could be used to determine the price of each book?
The width of a rectangle is 3 feet less than its length. The perimeter of the rectangle is 110 feet. Find its dimensions.
The Rocket Coaster has 17 cars, some that hold 7 people and some that hold 7 people. There is room for 73 people altogether. How many 7-passenger cars are there? How many 7-passenger cars are there?
Terry leaves his house riding a bike at 18 km/h. Sally leaves 5 h later on a scooter to catch up with him travelling at 82 km/h. How long will it take her to catch up with him?

You are running a concession stand at a basketball game. You are selling hot dogs and sodas. Each hot dog costs $1.53 and each soda costs $0.27. At the end of the night you made a total of $77.91. You sold a total of 85 hot dogs and sodas combined. You must report the number of hot dogs sold and the number of sodas sold. How many hot dogs were sold and how many sodas were sold?
One lemon cookies plus four fudge cookies have 401 calories.  Zero lemon cookies plus two fudge cookies have 427 calories. How many calories are in each kind of cookie?
The perimeter of a rectangle is 52 inches. The length of the rectangle is 7 inches more than the width. Determine the dimensions of the rectangle.

You have been given $10000 to invest. Safe investments, like certificates of deposit, pay about 5.5% interest. The stock market is much riskier but pays about 12%. If you would like to earn about 10% a year on these investments, how much should you invest in CDS and how much should you invest in stocks?
The length of a rectangle is equal to triple the width. Which system of equations can be used to find the dimensions of the rectangle if the perimeter is 89 centimeters?

An airplane flying with the wind can cover a certain distance in 1 hour. The return trip against the wind takes 1.5 hours. How fast is the plane and what is the speed of the air, if the one-way distance is 300 miles?
Joey and Natasha start from the same point and walk in opposite directions. Joey walks 2 km/h faster than Natasha. After 1 hours, they are 29 kilometers apart. How fast did each walk?
If twice the age of son is added to age of father, the sum is 56. But if twice the age of the father is added to the age of son, the sum is 82. Find the ages of father and son.

The manager of a specialty food store combined almonds that cost $3.84 per pound with walnuts that cost $2.12 per pound. How many pounds of each were used to make a 102 lb mixture that cost $3.63 per pound?

Bhavik bought 4 liters of milk and 8 loaves of bread for a total of $10. A month later, he bought 3 liters of milk and 2 loaves of bread at the same prices, for a total of $10. How much does a liter of milk cost, and how much does a loaf of bread cost?
The sum of the ages of Nicole and Kristin is 32. In two years, Nicole will be three times as old as Kristin. How old are they now?
Find the length and width of a rectangular garden if the perimeter is 150 m and the width is 23 m less than the length.
The sum of a three times a number, x, and twice another number, y, is 71. The difference of x and y is 7. Find x and y.
The length of a rectangle is 2 m more than twice its width. If the perimeter is 112 m, find the dimensions.
A total of $12000 is invested in two funds paying 9% and 11% simple interest. If the yearly interest is $1180, how much of the $12000 is invested at 9% and how much is invested at 11%?
White chocolate costs $1.76 per bar, and dark chocolate costs $2.39 per bar. If you buy 16 bars of chocolate for $34 dollars, how many bars of dark chocolate did you buy?
A 8998-seat amphitheater has tickets for sale at $35 and $61. How many tickets should be sold at each price for a sellout performance to generate a total revenue of $382500?

An executive traveled a total of 2 hours and 874 miles by car and by plane. Driving to the airport by car, she averaged 51 miles per hour. In the air, the plane averaged 322 miles per hour. How long did it take her to drive to the airport?
Two angles are supplementary. If one angle is 36° less than twice of the other angle, find the two angles.
Harry’s $2200 savings is in two accounts. One account earns 4% annual interest and the other earns 5%. His total interest for the year is $69. How much does he have in each account?
How many gallons of 18% alcohol solution and 50% alcohol solution must be mixed to get 8 gallons of 30% alcohol solution?

On a 220 mi trip, a car traveled at an average speed of 50 mph and then reduced its average speed to 35 mph for the remainder of the trip. The trip took a total of 5 h. How long did the car travel at each speed?

Alex bought some chips and pop for his class party. He bought a total of 30 items. Each bag of chips cost $0.83 and each bottle of pop cost $2.3. He spent a total of $40.09. How many bags of chips and how many bottles of pop did he buy?

Joe spends 2 hour each morning exercising by jogging and then cycling for a total of 16 miles. He is able to average 8 miles per hour jogging and 18 miles per hour cycling. How long does he spend jogging each morning?
Two bicycle riders start from the same point and ride in opposite directions. One rider is moving twice as fast as the other. In 5 hours, they are 70 miles apart. Find the rate of each rider.
Two angles are supplementary. The larger angle is 47 degrees more than 10 times the smaller angle. Find the measure of each angle.

A ground meat mixture is formed by combining meat that costs $2.22 per pound with meat that costs $4.36 per pound. How many pounds of each were used to make a 50 lb mixture that costs $2.95 per pound?

How many gallons of a 20% antifreeze solution and a 10% antifreeze solution must be
mixed to obtain 40 gallons of a 16% antifreeze solution?

At a restaurant three people order fried crab claws and four people order a cup of gumbo, with a total bill of $30. If only five people had ordered the crab claws and one person ordered the gumbo, the bill would have been $12.43. How much is each order of fried crab claws and each cup of gumbo?

Liam’s football team scored a total of 46 separate times this season, with a mix of touchdowns and field goals. Each touchdown is worth 6 points, and each field goal is worth 1 points. If the team scored a total of 302 points this season, how many touchdowns and field goals did they score?

Pi High School ordered 43 science books. The next week, the school ordered 28 algebra books. The bill for the first order was $360 greater than the bill for the second order. The two bills together totaled $3963. Find the price of an algebra book.

Jacob bought some tickets to see his favorite singer. He bought some adult tickets and some children’s tickets, for a total of 9 tickets. The adult tickets cost $10 per ticket, and the children’s tickets cost $8 per ticket. If he spent a total of $76, then how many adult and children’s tickets did he buy?
The width of a rectangle is 10 cm less than the length. The perimeter is 156 cm. Find the width and length.

Tom and Jerry drove 271 total miles in 3 hours. Tom always drives 41 mph and Jerry always drives 58 mph. It's a wonder they can manage to remain friends. How many hours did Tom drive and how many hours did Jerry drive?

Jacob bought some tickets to see his favorite singer. He bought some adult tickets and some children’s tickets, for a total of 9 tickets. The adult tickets cost $8 per ticket, and the children’s tickets cost $7 per ticket. If he spent a total of $78, then how many adult and children’s tickets did he buy?
The length of a rectangle is 14 inches more than twice its width. If the perimeter is 89 inches, what are the dimensions of the rectangle?
The perimeter of Peter's rectangular garden is 97 meters. The width of the garden is 63% shorter than its length. Find the dimensions of the rectangular garden in meters.
Renee left the restaurant traveling 20 mph. Then, 5 hours later, Karen left traveling the same direction at 27 mph. How long until Karen catches up with Renee?
The perimeter of a rectangle is 32 centimeter. The length is four more than twice the width. Find the length and the width of the rectangle.
Two complementary angles have measures of x and y. If y is 89 degrees less than twice x, which system of linear equations can be used to determine the measure of each angle?
Solution A is 49% acid and solution B is 80% acid. How much of each should be used to make 102 cc of a solution that is 66% acid?
Fran invested $699 in two funds that pay 7% and 4.88% annual interest. Fran’s combined annual interest is $40.58. How much of the $699 was invested in each fund?
A chemist wants to make 52ml of a 16% acid solution by mixing a 15% acid solution and an 17% acid solution. How many milliliters of each solution should the chemist use?

You and a friend go to Tacos Galore for lunch. You order three soft tacos and four burritos and your total bill is $11.59. Your friend's bill is $10.43 for six soft tacos and three burritos. How much do soft tacos cost? How much do burritos cost?

Emily went to the movie theater for her birthday. A mix of adults and children attended, making a total of 25 people. Each adult ticket was $12 and each child’s ticket was $5.91. If the total cost for the party was $125.48, then how many adults and how many children attended?

On total $15002 are deposited into simple interest accounts. The annual simple interest rate on one account is at 8%, the annual simple interest rate on the second account is at 5%. How much should be invested in each account so that the total interest earned is $968?
Two bicycle riders start from the same point and ride in opposite directions. One rider is moving twice as fast as the other. In 2 hours, they are 74 miles apart. Find the rate of each rider.

Eudora ran from her home to her secret laboratory at an average speed of 10 km/h. She then took one of her jetpacks and flew to her school at an average speed of 75 km/h. Eudora traveled a total distance of 122 kilometers, and the entire trip took 1 hours. How long did Eudora run and how long did she fly?
A 9000-seat amphitheater has tickets for sale at $35 and $62. How many tickets should be sold at each price for a sellout performance to generate a total revenue of $382500?
The sum of a number, x, and another number, y, is 61.9. The difference of x and y is 20.8. Find x and y.

Two hundred and eighty-one people attended a recent performance of Cinderella. Adult tickets sold for $3 and children’s tickets sold for $5 each. Find the number of adults and the number of children that attended the play if the total revenue was $1049.
A chemist wants to make 49ml of a 18% acid solution by mixing a 15% acid solution and an 17% acid solution. How many milliliters of each solution should the chemist use?
Two times the larger of two numbers is equal to five times the smaller. The sum of the numbers is 21. Find the numbers.

Randi and her daughter, Sierra, are white water rafting in Colorado. At the start of the day they are 160 miles apart. They begin traveling toward each other at the same time. Sierra's raft is traveling 8 mph faster than Randi's. If they meet in 5 hours, how fast was Randi's raft traveling?

Shana invests some money in an account that earns 7% simple interest and five times that amount in an account that earns 5% simple interest. If the total interest is $393 at the end of one year, find the amount invested in each account.
In a two digit number. The units digit is thrice the tens digit. If 34 is added to the number, the digits interchange their place. Find the number.
The perimeter of a rectangle is forty-one inches. The length is four inches more than five times the width. Find the dimensions of the rectangle.
The width of a rectangle is 6 feet less than its length. The perimeter of the rectangle is 111 feet. Find its dimensions.

A grocery store offers a cheese and fruit sampler that combines cheddar cheese that costs $9 per kilogram with kiwis that cost $2 per kilogram. How many kilograms of each were used to make a 7 kg mixture that costs $4.49 per kilogram?

On total $14999 are deposited into simple interest accounts. The annual simple interest rate on one account is at 6%, the annual simple interest rate on the second account is at 7%. How much should be invested in each account so that the total interest earned is $969?

The Lopez family had a rectangular garden with a 20 foot perimeter. They enlarged their garden to be twice as long and three feet wider than it was originally. They had to, since their cherry tomato plants were getting out of control. The enlarged garden has a 40 foot perimeter. What were the dimensions of the original garden?

The crew for the spaceship ZETA must be chosen from aliens of 2 different species: Romulans and Webbans. Romulans have 5 hands and Webbans have 11 hands. If there are exactly 29 crew members, and the crew must have a total of exactly 85 hands , then how many aliens of each species must be chosen?

Amanda borrowed $5001 from two sources: her parents and a credit union. Her parents charged 3% simple interest and the credit union charged 7% simple interest. If after 1 year, Amanda paid $228 in interest, how much did she borrow from her parents, and how much did she borrow from the credit union?
A grocer wishes to mix sugar at 7 cents per pound with sugar at 6 cents per pound to make 61 pounds at 9 cents per pound. What quantity of each must he take?

A dolphin swimming against an ocean current traveled 60 miles in 2 hours. It then turned around to swim with the current and was able to get back to its starting place in 1.5 hours. Find the speed of the dolphin in still water and the rate of the current.
A farmer has two types of milk, one that is 26% butterfat and another which is 18% butterfat. How much of each should he use to end up with 43 gallons of 18% butterfat?

Two planes have a cruising speed of 570 km/h without wind. The first plane flies for 12 hours against a constant headwind. The second plane flies for 10 hours in the opposite direction with the same wind (a tailwind). The second plane flies 370 km less than the first plane. Determine the wind speed and the distance travelled by the first plane.

The manager of a specialty food store combined almonds that cost $4.39 per pound with walnuts that cost $2.15 per pound. How many pounds of each were used to make a 100 lb mixture that cost $2.74 per pound?

An ounce of milk contains 37 milligrams of calcium and 57 micrograms of vitamin A. An ounce of orange juice contains 5 milligrams of calcium and 65 micrograms of vitamin A. How many ounces of milk and orange juice should Jasmine drink each day to provide exactly 500 milligrams of calcium and 1,200 micrograms of vitamin A?

The perimeter of a rectangular wooden deck is 91 feet. The deck's length, x, is 6 feet less than 3 times its width, y. Which system of linear equations can be used to determine the dimensions, in feet, of the wooden deck?

A ground meat mixture is formed by combining meat that costs $2.20 per pound with meat that costs $4.20 per pound. How many pounds of each were used to make a 50 lb mixture that costs $3.00 per pound?

Elizabeth and her sister earned money shoveling snow over winter break. Altogether, they shoveled for a total of 33 hours. Jenna charged her customers $10 per sidewalk, and her sister charged $13 per sidewalk. If they earned $347.61 total, how many hours did each girl spend shoveling?
The sum of Clyde and Wendy’s ages is 64. In five years, Wendy will be two times as old as Clyde. How old are they now?

An airplane flying with the wind can cover a certain distance in 5 hours. The return trip against the wind takes 1.9 hours. How fast is the plane and what is the speed of the air, if the one-way distance is 599 miles?

A student lives 9 km from school. On her morning commute, she walks to a bus stop at an average speed of 8 km/h. She then rides the bus for the remainder of the distance, at an average speed of 45 km/h. If the entire trip takes 35 minutes, what are the times spent walking and riding the bus?
Two bicycle riders start from the same point and ride in opposite directions. One rider is moving twice as fast as the other. In 1 hours, they are 71 miles apart. Find the rate of each rider.
Frances and Larry live 306 miles apart. They start driving towards each other and meet in three hours. If Frances drives 12 mph faster than Larry, find Larry's speed.
A farmer has two types of milk, one that is 24% butterfat and another which is 18% butterfat. How much of each should he use to end up with 42 gallons of 20% butterfat?
If the length of a rectangle is 4 m less than twice the width, and the perimeter is 42 m long, find its length and width.

The length of the Odra in Moravia is 44% of its length in Poland. The total length of the flow from the source to the sea is 1167 km. What is the distance in Moravia, and what is the distance in km on the Polish side?
The difference of two numbers is 15. The greater number is 7 less than 5 times the smaller number. Find the two numbers.

Noah's class held a food drive for the holidays. There are a total of 25 students in his class. Each boy brought an average of 3 cans and each girl brought an average of 6 cans for a total of 105 cans. How many girls are in class?
The length of a rectangle is 10 inches more than twice its width. If the perimeter is 89 inches, what are the dimensions of the rectangle?
The sum of two numbers is 16. The difference between the larger number and the smaller number is 9. What is the value of the smaller number?
The length of a rectangle is equal to triple the width. Which system of equations can be used to find the dimensions of the rectangle if the perimeter is 85 centimeters?
The perimeter of Peter's rectangular garden is 98 meters. The width of the garden is 60% shorter than its length. Find the dimensions of the rectangular garden in meters.
Ross Labs needs to make 3201 gallons of 40% acid solution. They have 39% acid solution and 55% solution. How many gallons of each type are needed to make 3201 gallons of the 40% acid solution?
How many gallons of 22% alcohol solution and 53% alcohol solution must be mixed to get 8 gallons of 29% alcohol solution?
Two angles are complementary. The larger angle is 2 degrees less than twice the measure of the smaller angle. Find the measure of each angle.
The larger of two numbers is 11 more than twice the smaller number. The sum of the numbers is 1 less than seven times the smaller number. Find the numbers.
The sum of the digits in a two-digit number is 14. Furthermore, the number itself is 2 greater than 11 times the tens digits. Find the number.

A class of 30 consists of students who either have red or yellow shirts. If there are 14 more people with red shirts than there are people with yellow shirts, how many of the students have red shirts?
A lumber company combined oak wood chips that cost $2.51 per pound with pine wood chips that cost $2.53 per pound. How many pounds of each were used to make an 83 lb mixture costing $2.69 per pound?
A boat traveled 213 miles downstream and back. The trip downstream took 10 hours. The trip back took 68 hours. What is the speed of the boat in still water? What is the speed of the current?
Harry’s $2200 savings is in two accounts. One account earns 2% annual interest and the other earns 6%. His total interest for the year is $68. How much does he have in each account?
A total of $12000 is invested in two funds paying 9% and 11% simple interest. If the yearly interest is $1180, how much of the $12,000 is invested at 9% and how much is invested at 11%?
A total of $11999 is invested in two funds paying 8% and 10% simple interest. If the yearly interest is $1179, how much of the $11999 is invested at 8% and how much is invested at 10%?
The perimeter of a rectangular swimming pool is 150 feet. The length is 18 feet more than the width. Find the length and width.
The sum of a twice a number, x, and another number, y, is 1. The difference of x and y is -0.15. Find x and y.

Alex bought some chips and pop for his class party. He bought a total of 32 items. Each bag of chips cost $0.75 and each bottle of pop cost $2.19. He spent a total of $39.84. How many bags of chips and how many bottles of pop did he buy?
The length of a rectangle is seven more than its width. The perimeter is two more than eight times the width. What are the rectangle's dimensions?
A 9002-seat amphitheater has tickets for sale at $33 and $65. How many tickets should be sold at each price for a sellout performance to generate a total revenue of $382499?

Sophia earned some extra money by baby-sitting over the summer. She charged $6.4 per infant, and $9.11 for any child over the age of 3. She earned a total of $244.99 while baby-sitting for 30 children. How many infants and how many children over 3 did she babysit?

In Lewis Carroll’s Through the Looking Glass, Tweedledum says, “The sum of your weight and twice mine is 362 pounds.” Then Tweedledee says, “The sum of your weight and twice mine is 363 pounds.” Find the weights of Tweedledum and Tweedledee.

Alex bought some chips and pop for his class party. He bought a total of 32 items. Each bag of chips cost $0.06 and each bottle of pop cost $1.97. He spent a total of $39.38. How many bags of chips and how many bottles of pop did he buy?
A grocer is mixing 40 cent per lb. coffee with 60 cent per lb. coffee to make a mixture worth 54c per lb. How much of each kind of coffee should be used to make 70 lb. of the mixture?
